result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Christopher McCarty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost on each count (2) for a total of $581.20 to be paid to the Clerk of Courts office . $25.00 per month payment plan to begin on 6/1/16 and the 1st of each month thereafter. Failure to pay will be warrant.
Must pay one (1) DNA surcharge of $250.00.

Not to possess or consume alcohol.  
Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Must obtain High School Diploma or its equivalent within first two (2) years of probation.

timeConds.notes:
Total of 12 months conditional time: 6 MONTHS TO BE SERVED UPFRONT, 
and 6 months to be banked.   
Eligible for Huber.
There is NO credit towards conditional time, but there are 203 days of credit toward an ultimate sentence if revoked.

Must complete 25 hours for each year of probation served for a total of 125 hours.
Concurrent with: 12CF412 Count 1

supervisions.notes:
Subject to Good Time & Work Release.  
824 days sentence credit = TIME SERVED.
Any outstanding financial obligation still due and owing will be reduced to a civil judgment and payable at the Clerk of Court's Office.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

- Eligibility for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
- May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
- If not a U.S. citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Subject to Good Time & Work Release.  
824 days sentence credit = TIME SERVED.
Consecutive to: Count 2

- Eligibility for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
- May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
- If not a U.S. citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

9:10 AM. Attorney Nicholas R White appeared by phone means for Defendant Matthew Christopher McCarty. Prosecuting Atty Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp appeared for State of Wisconsin. CT directs that 203 days credit be reflected as to the orig JOC.  AMENDED JOC to be drafted on orig sentence.
CT finds elig for CIP and SA pgm.  
Count 2-maintain drug trafficking place-360 days PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  Credit 824 days = time served.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Count 4-poss methamphetamine- 360 days PCJ, consecutive to count 2.  Credit 824 days, time served.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

CASES: 12CM141- SEHR, 12CF412- MH, 15CF68- FPT, Defendant Matthew Christopher McCarty in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab and attorney Daniel Firkus.  Defendant Matthew Christopher McCarty in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 8:50am 

12CM141 SEHR:  30 days jail, 203 sent credit- time served, $265.60 fine/cost. $25/mo PP beg 6/1/16 and 1st of e/m thereafter.

12CF412 Ct 3: 203 days in jail, concurrent to sentence Ct 1 in 12CM141, time served, $265.60 fine/cost. $25/mo PP beg 6/1/16 and 1st of e/m thereafter.

12CF412 Ct 1: I/S 3.5 - 1.5 IC 2 ES,  5 yrs prob, AS, sub to testing, no para, AODA & comply, $290.60 fine/cost, $25/mo PP beg 6/1/16 and 1st of e/m thereafter. DNA sample & surcharge, cannot possess firearm, cannot vote, if not us citizen could be deported, 25 hours of CS for each year of prob- can be done all up front- 125 hrs total, elig for SAP, elig CIP, bank 180 days cond'l time for use of agent if necessary. 


15CF68 Ct 2 & Ct 4- Def pleas of G. CT accepts pleas, finds G, enters JOC. DRI Cts 1, 3 and 5. 

SENTENCING ON 15CF68 Cts 2 & 4:  W/H sent, prob 5 years, 12 mos cond'l time: 6 mos upfront, 6 mos banked, no credit towards towards cond'l time, 203 days towards an ultimate sentence if revoked, elig for CIP and SAP, concurrent in 12CF412 Ct 1, must report to jail 9/6/15 at noon, no alcohol, no illegal subs, 25 hours CS for each year-125 hours total- concurrent to 12CF412 Ct 1, diploma or equiv w/in first 2 years of prob, $290.60 on each Ct (2), one DNA surcharge of $250.  $25/mo PP beg 6/1/16 and 1st of e/m thereafter.
